availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel Webster ("Black Dan" - Marshfield, Plymouth County, Massachusetts, attorney and statesman)

body.p: Marshfield, Plymouth County, Massachusetts attorney and statesman. New Hampshire native. Son of Ebenezer Webster and Abigail Eastman Webster. Married to Grace Fletcher Webster in New Hampshire on May 29, 1808. Married to Caroline Roy Webster in New York, New York, on December 14, 1829. Educated at Dartmouth College, graduating in 1801. Elected as a Federalist to the House of Representative for the state of New Hampshire from 1813-1817. Elected to the House of Representative for the state of Massachusetts from 1823-1827. Elected Senator for the state of Massachusetts from 1827-1841. Appointed and served as Secretary of State for the United States of America from 1841-1843. Elected as a Whig Senator from Massachusetts from 1845-1850. Appointed and served as Secretary of State for the United States of America from 1850-1852. Employed John Mason as a servant in Marshfield, Plymouth County, Massachusetts in 1850.
